ej,meyer101,P,barla901,Call at 1B (Threw ball; bumped umpire) $Russ Meyer waved his hand in disgust at the call at 1B and was ejected by 1B umpire Al Barlick; as Meyer left the field, he tossed the ball and it struck Barlick on the leg; Meyer then ran to Barlick and bumped the arbiter; Phillies manager Eddie Sawyer took Meyer off the field

$in the previous game, Eddie Stanky had stood behind 2B and waved his arms each time Andy Seminick batted; the Phillies had protested this action as unsportsmanlike; crew chief Al Barlick tried to contact NL president Ford Frick before this game to ask for a ruling; Barlick talked with Giants manager Leo Durocher about this; Durocher agreed to have Stanky stop until Frick could rule on it, since there was nothing in the rule book about it; here Stanky waved his arms but froze in place a Sheldon Jones started his pitching motion
$Andy Seminick struck Hank Thompson on the jaw with his elbow on an attempted tag at 3B; Thompson was knocked out

ej,stane101,P,warnl101,Waving arms to distract batter Eddie Stanky ejected by 2B umpire Lon Warneke for waving his arms to distract Andy Seminick; Durocher had called off the prohibition after Seminick hurt Hank Thompson; Seminick threw his bat onto the diamond after the second pitch and Stanky was tossed for 'conduct detrimental to baseball'; Durocher protested the game
